messages.message: *Please refer this thread for updates regarding Notebook issue* :arrow_up:

*Status: Investigation in progress* 
*Update:* 
We [me @Ashishand @Naveen] are looking to root-cause the problem. :eyes:

At initial look, We suspect JS isnt loading correctly due to either:
a) account service, or
b) improper redirects due to cluster level changes. ..

*Update:*
*We this* https://github.com/jupyter/help/issues/537 is the potential root cause, we are currently figuring out what triggered this is NOW.

We have root caused the issue to the new version of dynamic proxy. When we deployed the new kubernetes infrastructure, we unintentionally pushed a newer version of dynamic proxy. This newer version of dynamic proxy appears to misbehave after running for a few hours. We are still unclear why dynamic proxy behavior becomes unpredictable. In order to resolve the problem, we reverted to the old version of dynamic proxy and all notebook operations appear to be normal now. We will continue to monitor the notebook stack.
